revised_title: Kinematics of Material Lines and Surfaces in Homogeneous Turbulence
tldr: The article investigates the effect of homogeneous turbulence on material lines and surfaces, demonstrating that they tend to lengthen and expand. The author proposes a hypothesis that the probability distribution of the distance between two particles in the fluid becomes independent of their initial separation as time increases, leading to a stationary random function of the distance.
